title: Chief Technology Officer
desc:
About Timescapes: 

Timescapes was born out of a passion for construction and technology, with a vision of transforming the construction industry through the power of visual data. Their solutions are deeply anchored in their history of working on construction projects and wanting to capture progress through time lapse imagery. With this they saw a unique opportunity to merge their knowledge with technology to drive innovative change in their sector. The culmination of their experience resulted in the design of Timescapes cameras and Timescapes Live platform.

Today, Timescapes is used by major construction companies in New Zealand, Australia, and Canada on over 400 projects—and they are just getting started!

Why Join Timescapes?
Opportunity to work with an organisation that is transforming their industry and has strong revenue, and funding secured for global growth. 
Collaborative, curious and inclusive culture that values teamwork and innovation.
Chance to make a meaningful impact and drive industry transformation.
Commitment to integrity, excellence, and delivering value to our customers.
Role Overview: 

As the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) at Timescapes, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping their technological vision and driving innovation. You'll guide a talented team of half a dozen engineers to develop products and solutions that are reshaping the construction industry. This is an exciting opportunity to make a significant impact, working in a fast-paced, but well-established startup environment where you will have a significant influence over the product and business. You will be charged with leading and growing a world class engineering team and helping to establish a visionary product/UI/UX department. 

Key Responsibilities:
Develop and execute the technology and product strategy and roadmap aligned with business goals.
Build and mentor high-performing teams, fostering a culture of collaboration and excellence.
Champion product development initiatives, ensuring efficient and effective processes.
Manage technology operations, vendor relationships, and budgets effectively.
Experience Required:
Hands-on technical expertise with a diverse skillset in software development. This is a small (but growing) team, and you will need to be able to deep dive into the technology. 
A track-record of clear and simplistic customer-centric decision making for technology products and services.
Strong leadership and management skills with a strategic vision.
Proven experience in leading product development initiatives.
Working knowledge of new technologies to continue innovating ahead of the curve
Clear and concise communication skills
If you're ready to take on this exciting challenge and be part of a dynamic team that's changing the world, then please apply online today.

title: Technology Lead
desc:
Ready to make an impact?
WooliesX is our team of cross functional experts who will build and extend our digital and data capabilities to ensure connected customer experiences. We work end-to-end within an Agile tribal model that allows us to deliver quickly and be ahead of the game.
Technology Leads ( Tech Leads ) at WooliesX New Zealand need to provide leadership to support the end to end digital business for New Zealand's leading online grocery retailer to support value delivery to our customer and our team.
Could you be our new Tech Lead?
About the Role | Mō te Tūranga
Tech Leads will work in a team of 3-5 engineers, a Product Manager, BA and QAs/test engineers to uplift the online platform that powers New Zealand's leading supermarket with significant growth plans.
It is a key role that involves providing technical leadership, mentoring team members, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive innovation, and achieve value delivery objectives within specified timelines.
About You | Mōu
You'll be responsible for maintaining coding quality, design and implementation of new and agreed architectures etc. You will also participate in forums within the tribe to share knowledge, experience, best practices and collaboratively redefine the new architecture of the systems.
You're curious and empathetic, with an eye for the bigger picture. You deal with complexity by collaborating with colleagues, listening to customers, testing ideas and continuously learning. You take authorship for what you create. You'll be expected to raise the standard of engineering.
You'll be someone with a passion for modern technology and an interest in e-commerce.
You will be a team player with excellent communication skills.
You are comfortable with ambiguity and will thrive on analysing problems, formulating solutions, and making those a reality.
You have a passion for quality and know what best-in-class engineering looks like and want to help drive the journey.
You're an engineer with years of experience dealing with complex problems at scale.
As the technical lead, you will
Have strong .NET skills including C#, ASP.NET MVC, .NET Core, WebAPI and Entity Framework.
Demonstrable experience in Unit Testing Principles.
Be always-on microservice architecture.
Have experience in REST APIs, strong MS SQL Server including performance optimization, Javascript, jQuery, HTML5/CSS3.
Have experience with CI/CD, infrastructure as code, DevOps, automation.
Be experienced with event streaming, service bus or message queues (Azure Event Hubs, Kafka, RabbitMQ or similar).
Bring in a strong understanding of web security (OWASP TOP 10, etc).
This is a challenging and rewarding role. You will be able to leave your mark and mentor & coach a bunch of talented individuals. Are you up to the challenge? If so - Apply now!
Working with Woolworths NZ | Me mahi tahi tatou ki Woolworths NZ
Our purpose is to make Kiwis' lives a little better every day.
There is plenty of scope for new ideas, lots of room for you to add value, and importantly, you'll be working with a business that touches the lives of three million New Zealanders a week. We offer a diverse range of career opportunities across our ecosystem.
Countdown
Cartology, Vineonline & CountdownX
Primary Connect
Wholesale Distributors Limited (Super Value & Fresh Choice)
We are proud to be a Work 180 endorsed employer for all women, view the great work we do here.
Come as you are | Nau mai, whakatau mai
We're an equal opportunity employer and are committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all.
If you're smart and good at what you do, let's work together | Me mahi tahi tatou

title: Data Analyst - Analytics Engineering
desc:
Company description:

Fisher & Paykel Healthcare is a world leader in the design, manufacture and marketing of medical devices, exporting to over 120 countries globally. We are an iconic New Zealand company with a consistent growth strategy ensuring an expanding range of innovative devices for use in respiratory care, acute care and the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea.


Job description:

We have an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst with a focus on data modelling and analytics engineering to join our Data Centre of Excellence. As the central data team, we support ongoing growth in analytics across our global company.
We are centred in ICT with strong connections across the organisation, putting us in a unique position to deliver business impact through analytics.
The Role
In this role, you will help create and maintain data assets and pipelines that supply some of our most critical reports. You will identify opportunities to deliver data to a broad range of business customers as efficiently and elegantly as possible.
Our Team
We are Fisher & Paykel Healthcare's central data and analytics team. Our rapidly growing team serves as our organisation's Data Centre of Excellence.
We provide guidance, training, and support to stakeholders around the business. We also build critical data solutions for the organisation that are scalable and secure with the goal of enabling managed self-service BI.
About You
You are intellectually curious and excited to learn.
You are proactive with your work, but also know when to ask for help.
You are adept at communicating complex concepts, such as relationship cardinality.
You enjoy seeing people's ‘eyes light up' when they realise just what good data and reporting can help them achieve.
You will seek out opportunities to enable better insights across the organisation.
You love championing best practices - seeing the impact they have on both your technical deliverables as well as the experience of your end users.
You bring a sense of humour to your work.
Skills and Experience
Experience working with an enterprise data and reporting platform. Microsoft Power BI experience preferred.
Experience working in a large organisation preferred, especially in an enterprise data role.
Experience building relational data models.
Experience with a coding language. DAX, SQL, JSON and Python experience preferred.
Tertiary qualification or similar in a technical discipline.
About the Company
Fisher & Paykel Healthcare is a world leader in the design, manufacture and marketing of medical devices, exporting to over 125 countries globally. We are a company with a consistent growth strategy, providing an expanding range of innovative devices for use in respiratory care, acute care, surgery and the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea. We are a team of approx. 3500 NZ based employees plus another 3000 located internationally.
We are located in Highbrook/East Tamaki on beautiful landscaped grounds, with free car-parking, E-car stations, a great employee insurance scheme - including Life, Critical Illness and Income Protection insurance. We are spoilt for choice with our onsite subsidised food & beverage outlets as well.
If this sounds like you? Then apply Now!

title: Online Data Analyst - New Zealand
desc:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com
 We are hiring freelance English speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
 This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task. 
 Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English
You must be living in New Zealand the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in New Zealand
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over. 
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.  
 Why Join the TELUS International AI Community? 
Earn additional income with flexible hours to fit your lifestyle
Better work-life balance
Be your own boss
Complimentary Well-Being package encompassing a wealth of well-being resources.
Be part of an online community
 Payment
Rate of pay per task is inclusive of reading task guidelines. Payment will be issued in accordance with the terms of the contributor agreement upon successful completion of tasks.

title: Analytics and Insights Specialist
desc:
Mō te Tūranga | About the Role
As an Analytics and Insights Specialist at Westpac, you'll play a pivotal role in supporting the bank's strategies and initiatives. Your expertise in analysing data will provide valuable insights and actionable recommendations across the product portfolio and customer journey, ultimately helping achieve desired outcomes.
We are looking for someone who strives to improve performance and can understand how to apply analytics to create real insight and address business needs. You will be energetic and passionate about influencing decisions and actions of others by leveraging data to support your arguments. Your ability to problem solve, build strong relationship and high attention to detail are other key qualities that will add value.
Nā tāu rourou | What will you bring?
Experience working with complex data and able to provide quality reporting to aid and enhance decision making in a large and complex organisation.
Ability to manage and build relationships with internal stakeholders and teams.
3+ years’ experience in using SAS and SQL to deliver business insights.
Experience with Power BI
Experience in delivering customer communications, from translating business requirements, through to data delivery and implementation (preferred).
Knowledge of the financial services industry including working knowledge of key banking metrics and measurements would be advantageous.
Solid verbal and written presentation and communication skills.
Westpac Hei Wāhi Mahi | Working at Westpac
As well as immersing yourself in a supportive team environment, you’ll be offered some of the best banking, and lifestyle benefits in the market along with:
4 weeks standard holiday + 5 additional days of wellbeing leave to support you to be your best
Additional purchased leave options up to 4 weeks per year
Banking benefits, insurance discounts and superannuation scheme
Career growth – we promote internal capability; we have programmes that recognise star performers
Generous parental leave – and top up government paid parental leave
School holiday subsidy - help you balance work and family during school holiday
Environmental and community care programmes
Ko mātou tēnei | Our Organisation
At Westpac, we’re working together to build a fairer and stronger New Zealand for our people, customers, and communities. For over 160 years we’ve been driven by our purpose to Create Better Futures Together.
What makes us unique are the incredible people we’re lucky enough to have walk through our doors every day. The giant ‘W’ on our building doesn’t just stand for Westpac – it says, double you. We’re a place that values, rewards and recognises individuality. Where you can be your whole self, your true self, and your best self. We’re recognised as a place where talent is developed, where passions are fuelled and where ambitions of all shapes and sizes thrive. And it all starts with you!
Tono mai ināianei! | Apply Now!
Apply today with your CV and Cover Letter. 
The people of Aotearoa, New Zealand hail from many cultures and backgrounds. At Westpac New Zealand, we draw on this enormous talent pool to cultivate a team rich in ability and empowered to reach its full potential. Our aim is to be brave challengers, celebrating our differences and relentlessly advocating for our customers. It starts with us – we believe that when we care deeply and do our best for our people, they’ll do their best for our customers. We encourage people from all walks of life to apply, including those who are neurodiverse, have chronic health conditions or disabilities – your attitude and passion are as important to us as your experience, qualifications and capabilities. 
Mahi tahi tātou, kaha ake tātou | Together Greater
Applications close:
19 May 2024

title: Data Entry Specialist
desc:
Freelancers
We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated individual with a background in nutrition to join our team as a Data Entry Specialist. 
In this role, you will be responsible for uploading recipes into our system, ensuring accuracy and consistency in the nutritional information provided.
Responsibilities:
Upload recipes into our database with accuracy and attention to detail.
Ensure that all nutritional information is correctly entered, including but not limited to calories, macronutrients and images.
Conduct research as needed to verify and validate nutritional data for each recipe.
Collaborate with our Nutrition Lead to ensure that all recipes meet our standards and guidelines.
Review and verify data for completeness and accuracy before final submission.
Communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to resolve any discrepancies or issues with data entry.
Maintain confidentiality and integrity of sensitive information.
Assist in other data entry tasks and projects as needed.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition, Dietetics, Food Science, or related field preferred.
Proven experience in data entry or a similar role, preferably in a nutrition-related setting.
Strong understanding of nutrition principles and knowledge of food composition.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.
Proficiency in using computer software and databases.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively to meet deadlines.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Adaptability and willingness to learn new systems and processes.
This is an excellent opportunity for individuals passionate about nutrition to contribute to a dynamic team environment and make a positive impact on our mission to provide accurate and helpful nutritional information to our users.
Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this role.
Join our team and be part of an exciting journey to help make the world a happier & healthier place !!

title: Master Data Analyst
desc:
Master Data Analyst 
We are Reckitt
Home to the world's best loved and trusted hygiene, health, and nutrition brands. Our purpose defines why we exist: to protect, heal and nurture in the relentless pursuit of a cleaner, healthier world. We are a global team united by this purpose.
Join us in our fight to make access to the highest quality hygiene, wellness, and nourishment a right and not a privilege.
About The Role
This role will be part of the Master Data Team for Reckitt's Covering both Hygiene and Health BUs. As a Master Data Analyst, you will work alongside the rest of the data team to ensure data integrity is maintained for the total ANZ business, you'll set an example to other members of the team and work closely with the Master Data Manager. This will facilitate best in class product launches, customer deliveries and data sharing between Reckitt and our customer (wholesalers and retailers).
Your Responsibilities 
Manage the Customer and Vendor set-up process including the sourcing of data from the business and management of the master data in SAP
Partner with Finance to manage customer and product pricing in SAP in order to ensure accurate invoicing and recording of revenue
Assistance to the Master Data team in the Material Creation Process to ensure that NPD’s (new product development) are completed for the stock in warehouse date.
Working with the Master Data Team, to assist them in ensuring that materials have the correct status and work with internal stakeholders to manage the discontinuation and obsoletion process on ERP system.
Partner with Finance to manage customer and product pricing in SAP in order to ensure accurate invoicing and recording of revenue
Maintaining local data in SAP
Managing stakeholder relationships and training for new users
KPIs are reported and agreed SLA’s (service level agreement) are achieved by the team.
Ensuring the Trackers are kept up to date to support the business.
Skills and Attributes We Are Looking For
Ability to be proactive, multitask and agile. 
Proven track record of building relationships outside of the Data function with well-developed communication skills
Well organised and able to meet agreed deadlines. 
A willingness to challenge generally accepted norms and the conceptual flexibility to find better answers.
In line with RB core values, the individuals in these positions will be achievement focused and able to work in a direct and often pressurized environment. Entrepreneurial skills in terms of innovation and problem solving are key along with perseverance, tough-mindedness, and ability to influence and demonstrate strong team working abilities and commitment.  
Intermediate Supply Chain Acumen
Intermediate Financial Acumen
Intermediate Analytical Skills
Intermediate Logistics Excellence
Qualifications and Experience
You have experience of master data in SAP (MM, MDG, SD, FI) as a minimum; additional SAP experience preferred.
Retail and / or FMCG experience desirable. 
What We Offer
With inclusion at the heart of everything we do, working alongside our four global Employee Resource Groups, we support our people at every step of their career journey, helping them to succeed in their own individual way.
We invest in the wellbeing of our people through parental benefits, an Employee Assistance Program to promote mental health, and life insurance for all employees globally. We have a range of other benefits in line with the local market. Through our global share plans we offer the opportunity to save and share in Reckitt's potential future successes. For eligible roles, we also offer short-term incentives to recognise, appreciate and reward your work for delivering outstanding results. You will be rewarded in line with Reckitt's pay for performance philosophy.
Equity 
We recognise that in real life, great people don't always 'tick all the boxes'. That's why we hire for potential as well as experience. Even if you don't meet every point on the job description, if this role and our company feels like a good fit for you, we still want to hear from you.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, disability or medical condition; colour, ethnicity, race, citizenship, and national origin; religion, faith; pregnancy, family status and caring responsibilities; sexual orientation; sex, gender identity, gender expression, and transgender identity; protected veteran status; size or any other basis protected by appropriate law.

title: Data Analyst
desc:
As our Data Analyst, you'll manage and analyze vast datasets, creating actionable insights for key stakeholders. Reporting to the Senior Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role, leveraging your expertise to uncover insights, drive informed decisions, and optimize processes.
The Role:
Join our Business Insights and Analytics team to work collaboratively with finance, sales, marketing, content and more!
Producing analytical solutions from data collection to visualisation with the output provided in a user friendly way with clear key takeaways.
Analyze sales performance, market share and financial data to inform critical decision making that enables continued business growth
Assist in the maintenance of our data flows from source to data warehouse using best practices and without loss of data integrity or security risk..
Assist in the maintenance of our data warehouse from a data transformation perspective.
Troubleshoot and debug issues, providing timely resolutions.
Keep up to date with the latest trends in the Business Intelligence sector.
Factor in the commercial and technical requirements of stakeholders in every activity, ensuring strategic alignment with MediaWorks' KPIs.
About you:
Qualified with a University Degree in Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering or similar your strength will be in conveying complex information into easy-to-understand dashboards and visualisations.
On the technical side, you'll have experience in:
Proficient in SQL and Microsoft Office suite is a must
Working knowledge of Tableau, Python and ELT/ETL process
High attention to detail with ability to present accurate and timely insights
Excellent verbal and written communication
Drive to discover efficiencies, improve process and adding value
Build and maintain collaborative stakeholder relations
The willingness to learn new systems and processes is essential
On offer:
Encouraging manager who will give you the tools and knowledge you need to thrive
Competitive salary with flexible working hours - 2 WFH days per week with further flexibility negotiable
Passionate, experienced team who will support you and together you will succeed
Ongoing career development opportunities
Bring your dog to work on Fluffy Fridays - Woof!
About us:
MediaWorks' award winning business includes some of the country's best-loved nationwide radio brands such as More FM, The Edge, The Breeze, The Rock, Mai FM, George FM, Humm, The Sound & Channel X. We are New Zealand's largest independent broadcaster, reaching 96% of Kiwis through our extensive portfolio of premium brands across radio, digital and live rova platform. Our outdoor division includes premium digital and static billboards and key transit media.

title: Senior Data Analyst | Team Leader - Data Analytics & Machine Learning
desc:
WSP is one of the world’s leading engineering and professional services firms. Our 67,000 trusted professionals are united by the common purpose — to create positive, long-lasting impacts on the communities we serve through a culture of innovation, integrity, and inclusion.

With over 150 years of experience in Aotearoa New Zealand. We are proud to have the blueprint of Aotearoa New Zealand, in our DNA and be involved in the projects that will continue to connect and support us for future generations. We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future.



Role title and location: Senior Data Analyst – Team Leader, Data Analytics & Machine Learning,  Auckland


The Role: To deliver and oversee the application of data analytics and machine learning across a range of infrastructure related projects for our clients.


Skills and Experience required: Relevant tertiary qualification. Preferably minimum of 10 years’

professional experience with data analytics, Machine Learning or applied statistics. Minimum 5-years

working in a Professional Services firm with direct client engagement. Minimum of 5-years of people

leadership, either as direct reports or through project teams.



This position is full time, 40 hours and 5 days per week.

The remuneration range for this position is $100,000 to $115,000


This is an exciting time for WSP New Zealand. If you are looking for a rewarding position in a dynamic organisation with a strong people-focused culture, then this is an opportunity that cannot be passed by.

WSP recognises and values the range of characteristics that make people unique, and we do this in an environment that celebrates individual and collective achievement. We believe embracing diversity and inclusion delivers positive experiences for people and clients.

He aha te mea nui o te ao. He tāngata, he tāngata, he tāngata.

What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people.

title: Data Analysts
desc:
Why you'd like it:
Well known Enterprise business
Work on an exciting large project that will make a difference to every NZ'er
Work alongside a diverse and talented team, collaborating on "feel good" projects
Flexible working, but MUST be able to get into Auckland CBD for set on-site days
The Story:
Now in a position of huge growth, this organisation is seeking a Data Analyst / Data Migration Specialist to join their team. You will be part of a brilliant team of Data Specialists working across a range of national programmes. This contract will be a 3 month contract to start, but with a high likelihood of extension.

Company Profile:
Our client is a one of New Zealand's most well-known enterprise employers. They are at the forefront of transforming the digital landscape in New Zealand's public sector through a range of brilliant national programmes.

Your Role:
As a key member of this team, you'll be responsible for executing SQL scripting tasks, and reporting, leveraging your strong expertise in this area. Additionally, you'll utilise your Power BI skills to contribute to the presentation layer of our clients data analytics platform. Specifically, you'll be involved in data migration projects, SSIS development, and ETL creation, ensuring the seamless transfer of critical data.

Your Fit:
Our client is looking for self-motivated individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and can hit the ground running. Strong SQL scripting experience is a must, ideally along with proficiency in Power BI and SSIS. You'll need to be adaptable and innovative, with the ability to work autonomously and problem-solve effectively. Technical data migration and scripting experience would be ideal.

Let's talk more. Please apply for the role if it sounds like you.
kate@digitalgarage.co.nz or 02102469280.

title: Head of Analytics and Reporting
desc:
About Les Mills International:
At Les Mills, unlocking and amplifying that inner drive to achieve our goals is something we’re not shy to say we’re great at. While the Les Mills gyms that you know and love smash it out here in Aotearoa, our hustle is taking Les Mills group fitness classes to the world.

Today, Les Mills Internationals programs are in 20,000 gyms in over 100 countries – pair that with the boom of our digital subscription service LES MILLS+ (like Netflix for our workouts), and it’s an exciting time to be a part of our global company. Our mission is simple – to create a fitter planet.

The role:
We are in search of a hands-on Head of Analytics and Reporting to become an integral part of our dynamic team. In this position, you will take the lead in managing and supervising all facets of our Business Intelligence (BI) operations. Working collaboratively with stakeholders throughout the organisation, you will deliver high quality reporting to enable informed decision-making and support our growth efforts. Your responsibilities will entail crafting and executing strategies for gathering, analysing, and understanding data to guide business choices and enhance operational effectiveness. This role will involve close collaboration with our Machine Learning and Data Engineering departments, as well as other teams on a global scale.

Key Responsibilities:
Developing and implementing a comprehensive BI strategy aligned with LMIs goals and objectives.
Providing leadership and direction to BI analysts (2x) to ensure timely delivery of high-quality BI solutions.
Developing and maintaining strong relationships with key stakeholders within LMI to ensure BI initiatives and outputs meet their needs and expectations.
Communicating BI insights and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders in a clear and compelling manner.
Collaborating closely with the Commercial and Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) team members to integrate operational and financial data effectively for improved performance storytelling.
Responsible for the maintenance of code with version control.
Requirements:
Strong experience in dbt, GIT and Snowflake a must
Expertise in designing reporting layer with SQL in modern data warehouses. Strong experience in writing SQL preferred.
4+ Years of relevant experience in BI and Data Analytics with a track record of successful BI implementations
Proven resilience: ability and desire to work in a fast paced, changing environment.
Ability to translate complex business and financial issues into readily understandable terms.
Self-starter, dynamic “doer” with a high level of resilience and tenacity.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to interact at all management levels.
What’s in it for you:
We operate as a flexible and hybrid workplace with a mix of working in the office and at home as a work scheme that enhances and encourages work/life balance. Whether that be working from home, going to the gym or doing school drop-offs/pick-ups, we want our employees to feel comfortable working in an environment they can thrive and feel empowered.

We offer some great benefits that include:
Free gym membership and LM+ Subscription
Health Insurance discount
Friday drinks
Monthly companywide parties/events
Global mobility
Dog friendly office
Volunteer day
Free fresh fruits & snacks
We are a Rainbow Tick certified organization committed to providing a flexible, diverse and inclusive environment. We believe our people are the only way to help us work towards some steep growth goals and industry-leading innovations. If you’re excited about this role, we encourage people of all backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t meet every requirement. We might have something waiting in the wings that you’d be perfect for. We value the concepts of togetherness, support, equity, and respect, and that begins with increasing diversity in our teams.

*Les Mills International is an Immigration Accredited Employer.

title: Customer Services/Data entry
desc:
Great environment in the heart of Avondale
Opportunity to grow your career
Hours: Mon - Fri - 8.30am - 5.00pm
Solo Plastics is a leading provider of plastic piping solutions that are sustainably designed, built and installed for a wide range of construction and infrastructure projects across New Zealand.
Due to an increased demand for our products and services, an opportunity has become available for a Customer Service Advisor to join this dedicated team. 
Your key responsibilities will include:
Answer customer enquiries and provide support via phone and email
Respond to sales enquiries and develop opportunities with new customers
Provide quotes
Process and generate work orders
Data entry
Interface with production to ensure service levels are met
Assist with sales administration and general support to the wider sales team
In a nutshell, the main purpose of this role is to provide proactive sales and customer service support.  Our preferred candidate will ideally have been in a similar kind of position and loves dealing with customers and providing next level service.  You will come with strong work ethic, great attitude and willingness to learn. Your strong interpersonal skills and excellent team spirit will just top it off.  
In return for your reliability and solid team work you will be compensated with a company who truly value their staff, provide learning opportunities and a place of work that has a great culture. Please apply below

title: Technology Product Owner - Data
desc:
Ko mātou tēnei | This is Us
Here at BNZ, it's about more than just banking. We work together in an agile, energising environment to create innovative solutions through our promise 'If you can imagine a better future, let's find a way'.
This is a fantastic opportunity for a technical Product Owner to join our Cards and Payments Data tīma (team) in Technology. In this role, you would be responsible to leading team of engineers to deliver cutting edge solution related to payments data services.
Here at BNZ we embrace flexible working, have a strong focus on career development and progression, as well as a range of great benefits, including 6 weeks annual leave! This is a fantastic opportunity to join us to make a real difference in the digital banking landscape!
Mō te Tūranga | About the Role
We sat down some of our Platform Managers, and they let us know the following about the tūranga (role).
What is the tīma culture and environment like?
You would be working with a leadership tīma that believes in empowering the tīma to outperform and achieve well defined goals. We have a culture that is collaborative, supports personal growth, and enables your tīma to do their best work.
What projects / work will the candidate be working on now and into the next year?
You would be responsible for leading and delivering various initiative related to building payments data products.
What is your management style?
I have a collaborative and transformational leadership style.
What is the most exciting thing about this opportunity?
This is an opportunity to lead a tīma of exceptional engineers dedicated to build amazing payments data product and the possibility to work in area of advanced data science.
What is the most challenging thing about this opportunity?
We're looking for someone with a strong understanding to manage the data related initiative and should have prior knowledge of working with payments systems.
What specific skills would be beneficial?
Technical Expertise: Deep knowledge of data platform technology, enabling effective communication on technical requirements and constraints.
Product Management: Ability to define product vision, develop roadmaps, and prioritize features based on user feedback, and data analytics.
Agile Proficiency: Deep understanding of Agile and Scrum methodologies to efficiently manage sprints, prioritize tasks, and navigate the development process.
Leadership and Communication: Strong leadership to motivate the tīma, with clear communication skills for articulating product goals and facilitating collaboration.
Stakeholder Management: Skills in managing and aligning stakeholder expectations, including excellent communication and negotiation abilities.
What will success look like for the candidate in this tūranga?
Seamlessly delivering projects with third-party teams.
Boosting user satisfaction and engagement.
Innovating and enhancing our processes and offerings.
Nau Mai ki te Pēke o Aotearoa | Come to the Bank of New Zealand
If you are keen to join a fun organisation where we are proud of our culture and how we are helping New Zealanders to 'Find their way', then please review the Job Description and show your interest by submitting your application - we can't wait to read it.
Please note applications close Tuesday 21 May 2024.
Please note that we will be reviewing applications throughout the advertising period and reserve the right to remove the advertisement at any point.

title: Junior Data Analyst
desc:
Do you want to work with exciting data from the #1 NZ online retailer? From the supply chain all the way to customer service?
We are looking for a recent graduate or someone with less than 3 years experience as a Data Analyst, looking for an exciting opportunity! Join our Business Intelligence team to help improve and maintain existing reports and dashboards as well as create new ones, delivering insights across the whole business, from the supply chain to sales, marketing, finance and more! 
 Your impact:
Working within the Business Intelligence team, this role helps build, maintain and improve BI reports providing business insights for decision making.
Design, improve and maintain reports and dashboards in our BI tools, including Tableau, Looker Studio.
Maintain datasets in a way that it is easily accessible and supports fast, efficient reporting. 
Work with our Development team to ensure reports are kept up to date to reflect changes in the underlying data structures. 
Develop reports with new, actionable insights to support decision-making company-wide. 
Obtain and maintain a comprehensive knowledge of Mighty Ape databases and associated technologies. 
Maintain reporting datasets in conjunction with developers to support fast, efficient reporting.
Work closely with other departments to produce reports that support their needs.
Keep up to date with the latest trends in the Business Intelligence sector. 
 A bit about you:
University Degree in Business Analytics or similar.
Proficient in SQL, preferably using AWS Redshift and/or Google BigQuery.
Proficient in Tableau, Looker Studio a plus.
Familiar with Google Analytics 4.
Familiar with AWS services (EventBridge, DMS, S3).
Knowledge of Python a plus.
High attention to detail. 
Ability to convey complex information into easy-to-understand dashboards and visualisations.
Possess an excellent work ethic.
Excellent communication skills both verbally and in writing 
Motivation to achieve expectations.  
Positive attitude and desire to have fun!
 What are the hours?
The hours and days of work are 40 hours a week, Monday to Friday.
This role is office based so the ideal candidate will be able to travel daily to our head office location in Highgate Parkway, Silverdale.
Applicants must be eligible to work permanently in New Zealand to be considered for this position.

title: Senior Data Analyst
desc:
THE ROLE:
The purpose of the role is to support our dynamic NZME teams by delivering data analysis, data modelling, data driven products, dashboards and insights related to NZME’s huge digital audience. Primarily, the role assists NZME editorial, e-commerce and advertising teams understand and activate the huge amount of data we have at hand. The goal is to provide expert, in-depth analysis to answer complex questions and model data so it can be activated. The role will participate in multi-disciplinary teams by building innovative data driven products including recommendation engines and other forecasting tools.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Data Modelling and Machine Learning:
Write SQL queries to combine, manipulate and analyse data in BigQuery
Use ML applications with Google Cloud Platform to model data for use cases such as:
Attribution modelling
Behaviour Modelling
Customer segmentation
Churn retention and propensity to purchase modelling
Content Recommendation Engines
Work closely with other team members such as Data Engineers to productionise ML Models.
Analysis and Insights
Work closely with internal business owners to understand user behaviours across NZME’s websites as well as business models and requirements.
Liaise with development teams to develop and maintain analytics tags to ensure key events are captured.
Analyse web and behavioural data to provide advice and recommendations to NZME teams. Eg. Analyse audience engagement and channel impact on article and e-commerce performance.
Provide data led recommendations to NZME teams to help them move the needle on their KPI’s.
Reporting and dashboards:
Build automated Dashboards to surface information to internal teams. You will use tools such as Google Data Studio and Tableau.
Work with other Data and Analytics Team members to identify opportunities to automate data pipelines and reports.
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
Tertiary qualified – statistics, applied mathematics, computer or data science.
3+ years of data and web analytics experience preferred.
Knowledge of the production and application of Machine Learning algorithm and strong SQL skills – BigQuery ML or other data warehouse preferred, experience working with GA data required.
Experience using Python for statistical applications required
A critical thinker with an analytical and curious mind-set with the ability to explain complex problems and solutions to business users.
Experience with Google Tag Manager or other tag management platforms is advantageous.
Experience with BI products such as Google Datastudio and Tableau essential.
Experience with the Google Cloud Platform preferred.
Team player with a sense of humour and a positive attitude.
You’ll be an effective communicator and will keep managers and colleagues updated on all necessary information.
Take responsibility for your on-going learning and make the most of personal development opportunities at NZME.
Knowledge of agile working principles will be advantageous.
THE PERKS:
So what do we offer in return? This is an amazingly diverse role, working with a modern and sophisticated data analytics stack and a mountain of data. You will be an integral part of a great team, working closely with some of the best brains in the business. A company culture where you’re encouraged to bring your whole self to work; where we’re diverse & inclusive and foster growth & development in our biggest asset – our staff! So what are you waiting for? It sounds like we’re made for each other!
Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work permit.

title: Data Architect
desc:
Why you would like it:
Lead in developing a cutting-edge agile data platform.
Crucial role in strategic data solutions impacting real time business decisions.
Collaborate with top-tier leadership, influencing high-level strategy.
The opportunity:

This is a pivotal time to join as our client aims to harness a wealth of data into a streamlined, real-time operational advantage. Situated either in Auckland (NZ) or Sydney (AUS), you'll take the reins as Data Architect, reporting directly to the Head of Strategy and Enterprise Architecture. Your mission? To sculpt an agile, reliable data platform that not just meets but drives business needs, by implementing robust data models. The focus is on crafting a data architecture that is both compliant and secure, steering the company towards enhanced data-driven decision-making processes.

Company profile:

Our client is a frontrunner in the fintech sector. They champion a culture that values strategic insight and proactive solution-building. With your role, expect to engage deeply with business processes and push the boundaries on compliance and data security, propelling the organisation towards its future.

The role:
Design, develop and maintain an innovative data architecture.
Ensure alignment of data solutions with business goals across various processes and systems.
Lead strategic initiatives in data storage, processing, and consumption layers.
Drive adoption of cloud technologies and sophisticated data modelling techniques.
Collaborate closely with development and production teams to enhance data utilisation.

Your fit:
Are you an emerging Data Architect? This role offers a fantastic opportunity to deepen your expertise in data strategy and architecture.
Ideal candidates will have experience with data modelling, warehousing, and a familiarity with cloud technologies.
You're known for your analytical skills and your ability to collaborate well across teams, bringing fresh ideas that drive compliance and data security. Here, your contributions will not only be recognized but will directly influence the strategic direction of the business.

Sounds like you're the perfect match? Apply now!


*** Only candidates with rights to work in NZ or Australia will be considered for this role ***

title: Enterprise Data Analyst
desc:
Our Client:

Our client is an Iconic market leading brand offering a range of products and solutions to service businesses all over New Zealand. They are currently embarking on a business wide transformation to help accelerate the next phase of their growth.

The Role:

To support the enterprise reporting platform through the maintenance of the tools, building reports and dashboards. Managing the deployment of dashboards and reports to users both internal and external through a variety of delivery methods. Champion the use of data visualization to support users using business tools for making decisions. Lead business in the use of predictive models to solve business problems.

Responsibilities:
Design business analysis and data recording systems for use throughout business
Complete requirements gathering for organisational reporting and dashboards presenting to reporting team for further analysis
Ensure data accuracy, integrity and quality of data models
Regularly examine data reports to locate and resolve mistakes throughout
Accurately collect, manipulate, analyze and interpret data for various types of business reports and recommendations
Create business reports that provide insight into key data points through visualisation techniques
Build data mining and predictive models
Communicate the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to managers
Support various departments, including marketing and sales, in reaching their goals through analysis
Monitor data to identify changes in financial and business trends
Experiment with new data models and technologies
What you’ll have
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Management or equivalent
2+ years’ experience delivering reporting and data visualization solutions
At least 1 year of experience as a financial or business analyst
Knowledge of industry best practices associated with reporting
General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow
Expertise in the development of data-driven reports
Experience with analytics tools including Excel, Power BI, Sisense
Experience with SQL and Java script
  
  
If you feel this role sounds right for you submit your CV with cover letter and the team at Rewired Consulting will be in touch.

We can only accept applications from candidates who have the right to live and work in NZ.

title: ADMINISTRATOR - DATA ENTRY
desc:
Are you detail-oriented and love keeping things organised? We're hiring a Data Entry/Administration Specialist to be part of our team.
Why join us?
Meaningful work, your accuracy will directly shape our success
Collaborative, supportive environment
Long established company working in construction for over 20 years
We are looking for someone with a minimum 2 years data entry experience in NZ with a positive and friendly manner.  
Key duties and responsibilities:
Customer service
Data Entry
Operational tasks
Workflow control
Staff support
What we are looking for:
Attention to detail
Strong customer focus and can do attitude
Reliable and a team player
Ability to learn quickly
Good communication, both written and spoken English
Data entry experience
If this sounds like you, please apply today with your cover letter and CV.

title: Senior Data Engineer
desc:
A bit about us:
SkyCity is one of Australasia's most popular casino and hospitality destinations who welcome and delight millions of customers each year. Our ICT Department is constantly looking at new and innovative ways of utilising cutting edge technology to enhance our offering to customers and staff and our ICT team work hard to succeed. Join our dynamic team as a Senior Data Engineer where you'll effectively contribute to streamlining our data platform landscape.
A bit about the Role:
Reporting to the Data Platform Engineering Team Leader, our Senior Data Engineer will deliver high-end, robust technical expertise in support of the function. You'll take charge of the technical delivery and maintenance of our data platform, encompassing build, operations, and continuous optimisation. This role is pivotal, demanding a high level of proficiency in modern data platform technologies. Lead through technical expertise, support teamwork, and actively contribute to the design and implementation of data platform enhancements.
A bit about You:
To be successful in the role, you'll bring with you a minimum of 7 years experience in data platform engineering, demonstrating expertise in constructing and enhancing data pipelines incorporating auditing mechanisms. You'll hold advanced skills in data modelling, processing, integration, unstructured data handling, and have proficiency in SQL with a focus on the Kimball methodology and established design patterns. Exhibit a track record of utilising source controls like GitHub or Azure Repos.
Leverage your ability to transform innovative ideas into tangible business opportunities and foster strong relationships with key business stakeholders using your excellent verbal and written communication skills!
What's in it for you:
You'll work with contemporary data platform technology to help the organisation supercharge its data-technology landscape and use of its data assets. This is within a supportive, diverse team that celebrates success. Furthermore, you will receive subsidised medical insurance along with heavily discounted car parking and $2.50 fully cooked meals in our staff cafeteria.
At SkyCity, our career opportunities are as diverse as our workforce. We don't just embrace differences; we value and support them. Our hiring is centred on capability and performance, regardless of gender, gender identity, race, origin, age, educational background, disability, or religious beliefs. We're here to empower you to shine. Our willingness to adapt ensures you can chart your path with us! Join us at SkyCity and be extraordinary by being you.

title: Data Engineer
desc:
ArchiPro is not just another online platform; the people here at ArchiPro are revolutionising an entire industry.
Today, building and renovating is a time-consuming, expensive, demanding, and fragmented process, and great design feels restricted to the privileged few. Separately, we’re witnessing industry after industry being revolutionised by technology, yet the building industry and all of the elements involved in the process have yet to undergo this level of digital innovation and transformation—until now. 
Meet ArchiPro—a cutting-edge all-in-one platform built on exceptional design and world-class engineering; we have quickly become a game-changing industry leader.
Every month, nearly half a million people use the Archipro platform to search for Products, connect with Professionals, and find Project Inspiration for their building projects. Our platform empowers businesses to grow online and helps millions of people embarking on their building journey find what they love and need, from architects, designers and builders to products and materials.

We are on a mission to simplify the end-to-end building experience and are looking for a Data Engineer to join our team.

ArchiPro is frequently ranked among the top 10 most disruptive companies in AU and NZ.
ArchiPro is backed by Tiger Global, one of the largest funds globally, and they only back the world's most exceptional companies. They have invested in Facebook, TikTok, Air BnB, Alibaba, Roblox, and Stripe. They believe the next $100b business in their portfolio is ArchiPro.
We have an excellent ESOP structure in place designed to not only reward you with a strong base and commission structure but also with the ability for you to have a stake in the business.
We have crushed New Zealand, we are disrupting Australia and now, we are gearing up to launch in California, and soon, we will be the default residential building platform globally.
The Role
As a Data Engineer - Snowflake Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in designing, building, and optimising our data pipeline and analytics architecture on the Snowflake platform. You will work closely with data analysts, software engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure data availability, quality, and reliability. Your expertise in Snowflake will drive the efficiency and scalability of our data ecosystem, enabling informed business decisions.
Our Tech and Data teams are the foundation of our success - from effective development practices, communication and relationships to internal design and product teams. We foster an entrepreneurial yet supportive environment where customer obsession defines us, ideas can come from anywhere and execution is everything.
If you're a self-directed, independent and experienced Data Engineer looking to make an impact and shape the direction of a fast-growing company and ultimately entire industries, this is for you.
Responsibilities
Data Quality and Model Accuracy: Ensure the highest standards of data quality and model accuracy, implementing rigorous testing and validation processes. 
Performance Optimisation: Leverage your Snowflake expertise to optimise both data and AI model performance, ensuring efficient processing and insightful analytics. 
Data Pipeline and AI Integration: Extend the responsibilities of data pipeline development to include the integration of AI models, ensuring seamless data flow and processing for AI applications. 
Data governance and data security practices: Ensure we’re using best practices to protect data and comply with regulatory requirements in multiple jurisdictions.
AI Strategy and Innovation: Act as the primary thought leader for AI within the organisation, proposing and implementing innovative AI solutions that enhance our platform offering and contribute to pilot projects. 
Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Maintain comprehensive documentation for AI models and data architectures, and share your knowledge to uplift the team's capabilities in data and AI.
For the curious minds
What our clients have to say: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yFcUn1JPZMY
What our team have to say: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s9IxfnTg9g0
Inside our offices: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VkVgL8j5kog&t=21s
For more on our success, you can read here: https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/online-buildin...
Our founder's inspirational story as featured in M2 Magazine: https://m2magazine.co.nz/refugee-to-digital-powerh...


Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.
Proven experience as a Data Engineer.
Expertise in Snowflake architecture, design, and performance optimisation.
Strong proficiency in SQL, database design, and data modeling concepts.
Hands-on experience with ETL tools and data integration techniques.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and data warehousing concepts.
Ability to write and optimise complex SQL queries for data extraction and transformation.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Strong communication skills to interact with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Snowflake certification(s) would be a definite advantage


Benefits

Competitive Salary
Long service 'ArchiVersary' leave - for every year of service you get an extra leave day
Opportunity to join our ESOP
Company tools of trade incl, Laptop (your preference Mac or PC)
Attend our frequent team initiatives & activities
Dog friendly workplace
Fresh fruit, barista coffee, snacks and a great lolly jar!
At ARCHIPRO, you're not just taking a job; you're igniting a career that makes a difference - we look forward to connecting!
Our Vision
Our vision is to empower people to create better spaces in which we experience life. To do this, we're making quality architecture more accessible, and this, in turn, will inspire people to invest in quality products and trusted professionals they need to get the job done on time and on budget.
Our Values
We are powered by design
The PRO mentality is in our DNA
We pursue excellence in everything we do
Our success is defined by our clients’ success
At the heart of our platform is the user
We’re a star team, not a team of stars
Join us and become a part of the ARCHIPRO team where you will not only shape the future of building and construction but also leave a lasting legacy in the industry.

title: Data and Process Administrator - 12 month fixed term
desc:
Company description:

Ready to make an impact?
We're looking for a Data and Process Administrator to join our Merchandise team here in Aotearoa, reporting to our Category Development Manager in this 12 month fixed term role.
Joining our team you'll take accountability for providing support to the Merchandise team on reporting, data collection and auditing to enable accuracy of records held. This is a business-facing role requiring significant interaction wih business stakeholders at multiple levels.


Job description:

About the Role | Mō te Tūranga
You will be responsible for:
Monitoring and supporting Merchandise compliance with the Grocery code through tasks like updating contact details required for Vendor Trading terms
Efficient and timely handling of information required for investigations and disputes for key internal stakeholders like our legal and Trading teams
Supporting all required Training Material Updates and supporting in maintaining records of participants
Price Integrity and reporting checks to ensure Merchandise Data is accurate and any issues are resolved in a timely manner
Investigate issues and ensure root causes are understood and addressed and proper escalation is in place
About You | Mōu
To succeed in this role you will need to be analytical and process driven, coupled with creative problem solving skills. Prior experienced within an FMCG environment is preferred, along with Google suite proficiency and familiarity SAP, PMR and GCP reporting functionality.
If you're the sort of individual who strives to always do the right thing for customers, team, our communities, and our business then we ought to connect.
Working with Woolworths NZ | Me mahi tahi tatou ki Woolworths NZ
Our purpose is to make Kiwis' lives a little better every day.
We're friendly, down-to-earth, and energetic - we work hard but we have a great time doing it, and we love what we do. There is plenty of scope for new ideas, lots of room for you to add value, and importantly, you'll be working with a business that touches the lives of three million New Zealanders a week.
Come as you are | Nau mai, whakatau mai
We're an equal opportunity employer and are committed to the principle of equal opportunity for all.
If you're smart and good at what you do, let's work together | Me mahi tahi tatou

title: Data Governance Specialist
desc:
Bula Vinaka!

Change your scene and become a VSA Volunteer and share your experience, knowledge, and skills to transform the lives of many. Work with our partner organisation to create a fair future for all. 
 
VSA will organise and fund, flights, visas, insurance, accommodation, living allowance and utilities while on assignment. 

Please note VSA Volunteers must be a NZ citizen or permanent resident. 

Volunteering with VSA 
Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA) is not your typical volunteering agency, we are committed to building sustainable communities across the Pacific. If you’re an experienced Data Governance Specialist, looking for an extraordinary overseas experience in the Pacific to build into your field of expertise – working collaboratively with the Pacific Islands Forum Secretariat. (PIFS), then read on, as we have an exciting opportunity in store for you!
 
Our Partner Organisation - The Pacific Islands Forum Secretariat. (PIFS).
The Pacific Islands Forum Secretariat (PIFS) is the region’s premier political and economic policy organisation. Founded in 1971, it comprises 18 members:
Australia, Cook Islands, Federated States of Micronesia, Fiji, French Polynesia, Kiribati, Nauru, New Caledonia, New Zealand, Niue, Palau, Papua New Guinea, Republic of the Marshall Islands, Samoa, Solomon Islands, Tonga, Tuvalu, and Vanuatu.

The Pacific Islands Forum Secretariat operates by fostering cooperation between governments, collaborating with international agencies and representing the interests of its members. The PIFS’s Pacific Vision envisions a region of peace, harmony, security, social inclusion, and prosperity, allowing all Pacific people to lead free, healthy, and productive lives.

The Assignment
This assignment is a partnership assignment between VSA and The Pacific Islands Forum Secretariat. 

In this assignment a VSA Volunteer will provide support as a Data Governance Specialist to strengthen the Forums data governance strategies, capacity, and capabilities and contribute to the development of a comprehensive and effective data governance strategy. The VSA volunteer will work alongside staff and stakeholders to assess the Forum’s current data governance practices, identifying areas for improvement, and delivering recommendations for tailored solutions to enhance overall data management capabilities.

The Volunteer
Are you someone who wants to make a difference, have a sense of adventure and like the challenge of being outside your comfort zone?  VSA Volunteers are technical experts who impart their skills and knowledge to the local community. You will need to be flexible, adaptable, resourceful, resilient with a passion for Aotearoa and the wider Pacific community.

We're looking for a volunteer with the following:
 Bachelor's or Master's degree in a related field (e.g., Data   Management, Information Systems, Business Analytics).
 Proven experience (10 years plus) in a data governance role, with a   focus on developing and implementing data governance frameworks.
 In-depth knowledge of data governance principles, data quality   management, and regulatory compliance.
 Sound project management skills.
 Familiarity with data management tools and technologies.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
 Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to   engage effectively with diverse audiences.
Desirable: 
• Experience with data governance tools and frameworks is desirable.
• Certification in data management or data governance is a plus.
• Experience working in a large-scale complex organisation.

The Country
Fiji includes the other 3 cultural groups called Fijians -Rotuma, Rabi, and Kioa (Rabian and Kioans) were resettled in Fiji after being evacuated from Ocean islands, Tuvalu and Kiribati).

It is a destination attraction for its coral reefs, clear lagoons, and tropical landscapes. Fijian indigenous society is very communal, with great importance attached to the family unit, the village, and the vanua (land). With the introduction of traditions such as Indian and Chinese and significant influences from Europe and Fiji's Pacific neighbours, particularly Tonga and Samoa, these various cultures have come together to create a multicultural national identity for Fiji.
  
Apply Now!

Apply for this amazing opportunity through our website. For more information on this assignment, email volunteer@vsa.org.nz.

To review the full assignment description please copy and paste the below link into your browser:

https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-2019-2020/2024/Febriaru-2024/Data-Governance-Specialist-FIJ-41954-PD.pdf

If you are on the VSA website, please click on the download assignment description tab above.
